required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Neprilysin on Glucagon-like Peptide-1
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Neprilysin on Glucagon-like Peptide-1

brief_summary.textblock: In the current study we wish to investigate the effects on glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) of a neprilysin inhibitor

detailed_description.textblock: Glucagon-like peptide-1(GLP-1) is secreted during a meal and increases glucose induced insulin secretion. The enzyme dipeptidyl peptidase 4(DPP-4) cleaves intact GLP-1 within minutes and DPP-4 inhibitors are therefore used for treatment of diabetic hyperglycemia. A few animal studies have implicated the enzyme neutral endopeptidase 24.11 (24.11) in the degradation of GLP-1 but if this is the case in humans is unknown. We therefore administered a NEP inhibitor, 194mg sacubitril, a DPP-4 inhibitor (sitagliptin 100mg the night before and 100mg 2 hours before), both, or place, to nine healthy men during a standardized meal and measured plasma concentrations of GLP-1

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The participants are on 4 study days with wash out period of minimum 2 weeks randomized to 4 intervention arms

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours after treatment ( during the subsequent standardized meal)
primary_outcome.description: changes in plasma GLP-1 using immunological methods: intact and total GLP-1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours after treatment ( during the subsequent standardized meal)
secondary_outcome.description: changes in C-peptide using immunological methods

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours after treatment ( during the subsequent standardized meal)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in Plasma glucagon concentrations using different analytical methodologies

other_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours after treatment and during the subsequent standardized meal
other_outcome.description: changes in blood glucose using immunological methods

other_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours after treatment ( during the subsequent standardized meal)
other_outcome.description: changes in plasma GIP using immunological methods

arm_group.description: No treatment. Participants are subjected to a standardized meal
194 mg sacubitril / 206 mg valstartan (entresto) as one single dose followed by a standardized meal
200mg sitagliptin (100mg the night before and 100mg on the study day) as one single dose followed by a standardized meal
194 mg sacubitril / 206 mg valstartan (entresto) + 200mg sitagliptin (100mg the night before and 100mg on the study day) as one single dose followed by a standardized meal

intervention.description: Single dose administration of Entrestro 194 mg sacubitril / 206 mg valstartan

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- men
- body mass index between 20-25
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute diseases within the two weeks
- chronic diseases
- smoker
- alcoholism, drug addiction or recent weight loss
- blood donation within the last 3 months

results_reference.citation: Wewer Albrechtsen NJ, Mark PD, Terzic D, Hansen LH, Andersen UÃ˜, Hartmann B, Carr RD, Gustafsson F, Deacon CF, Holst JJ, Goetze JP, Plomgaard P. Sacubitril/valsartan augments postprandial plasma concentrations of active GLP-1 when combined with sitagliptin in men. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2019 May 10. pii: jc.2019-00515. doi: 10.1210/jc.2019-00515. [Epub ahead of print]
